text: Did you see an essential part of me back then that I couldn't see in myself?
How do you feel loving me, or being loved by me, genuinely changed you?
Is there a beautiful lesson from our time together that you still carry with you?
Describe a fond memory of 'us' that still brings a smile to your face.
What did our relationship teach you about what you truly need or desire in a partner?
Is there anything you wish you had said to me during our time together, but didn't?
Which quality in me did you genuinely admire or appreciate?
Looking back, what do you consider our greatest strength as a couple?
Conversely, what was the biggest challenge we ultimately couldn't overcome?
How do you remember the very beginning of our story, when we first connected?
In what way, if any, do you feel our ending contributed to your personal growth?
Is there a particular song, place, or object that still strongly reminds you of 'us'?
Share one thing you now understand about me that you didn't grasp back then.
From a place of sincerity, what do you genuinely wish for me in my life now?
How did our connection influence the path your life took afterwards?
If you could offer our younger selves one piece of advice about the relationship, what would it be?
For which aspect of our shared time are you most grateful?
Do you believe we were 'meant to be,' even if it wasn't for forever?
In your mind, what is the most positive legacy of our time together?
If we had to describe 'us' in a single word now, from a place of peace, what would that word be?
